member.summary: The method to detour from. Set when the structure is created by the IDetourNativePlatform.

member.name: F:MonoMod.RuntimeDetour.NativeDetourData.Target
member.summary: The target method to be called instead. Set when the structure is created by the IDetourNativePlatform.

member.summary: The type of the detour. Determined when the structure is created by the IDetourNativePlatform.

member.name: F:MonoMod.RuntimeDetour.NativeDetourData.Size
member.summary: The size of the detour. Calculated when the structure is created by the IDetourNativePlatform.

member.name: F:MonoMod.RuntimeDetour.NativeDetourData.Extra
member.summary: DetourManager.Native-specific data.

The name to use instead of the reference's own name.
The ID to use instead of the reference's declaring type ID.
Whether the type ID should be included or not. System.Reflection avoids it by default.
Whether the method is regarded as a proxy method or not. Setting this paramater to true will skip the first parameter.
Whether the ID should be "simple" (name only).

member.name: M:MonoMod.Utils.Extensions.GetManagedSize(System.Type)
member.summary: Get the managed size of a given type. This matches an IL-level sizeof(t), even if it cannot be determined normally in C#. Note that sizeof(t) != Marshal.SizeOf(t), f.e. when t is char.
member.param: The type to get the size from.

member.name: M:MonoMod.Utils.Extensions.GetThisParamType(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Get a type which matches what the method should receive via ldarg.0
member.param: The method to obtain the "this" parameter type from.

member.name: M:MonoMod.Utils.Extensions.GetLdftnPointer(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Get a native function pointer for a given method. This matches an IL-level ldftn.
member.remarks: The result of ldftn doesn't always match that of MethodHandle.GetFunctionPointer(). For example, ldftn doesn't JIT-compile the method on mono, which thus keeps the class constructor untouched. And on .NET, struct overrides (f.e. ToString) have got multiple entry points pointing towards the same code.
member.param: The method to get a native function pointer for.

member.name: T:MonoMod.Utils.Relinker
member.summary: The relinker callback delegate type.
member.param: The reference (metadata token provider) to relink.
The generic context provided to relink generic references.

member.name: T:MonoMod.Utils.Platform
member.summary: Generic platform enum.

member.name: F:MonoMod.Utils.Platform.OS
member.summary: Bit applied to all OSes (Unknown, Windows, MacOS, ...).

member.name: F:MonoMod.Utils.Platform.Bits64
member.summary: On demand 64-bit platform bit.

member.name: F:MonoMod.Utils.Platform.NT
member.summary: Applied to all NT and NT-oid platforms (Windows).

member.name: F:MonoMod.Utils.Platform.Unix
member.summary: Applied to all Unix and Unix-oid platforms (macOS, Linux, ...).

member.name: F:MonoMod.Utils.Platform.ARM
member.summary: On demand ARM platform bit.

member.name: F:MonoMod.Utils.Platform.Wine
member.summary: On demand Wine bit. DON'T RELY ON THIS.

member.name: F:MonoMod.Utils.Platform.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown OS.

member.name: F:MonoMod.Utils.Platform.Windows
member.summary: Windows, using the NT kernel.

member.name: F:MonoMod.Utils.Platform.MacOS
member.summary: macOS, using the Darwin kernel.

member.name: F:MonoMod.Utils.Platform.Linux
member.summary: Linux.

member.name: F:MonoMod.Utils.Platform.Android
member.summary: Android, using the Linux kernel.

member.name: F:MonoMod.Utils.Platform.iOS
member.summary: iOS, sharing components with macOS.
